channel.title: Iron Scimmy (w)
channel.description: I realize the handle is messed up. I'll try to make it the Actual shape of a scimitar next time. Anyway, here it is. v1 [img]http://i618.photobucket.com/albums/tt269/thedouchebagger/IronScimmyW.jpg[/img] v2 [img]http://i618.photobucket.com/albums/tt269/thedouchebagger/ironscimmy2.jpg[/img]

item.title: Iron Scimmy (w)
item.dc:creator: @0bbyme 0bbyme
item.description:
@0bbyme wrote:

v2 looks better then v1. a big improvement but dont forget that primative modeling is not a bad thing as long as you are using your brain while using them. like u could use a cylinder for a handle and maybe extrude some faces and make a wavy effect too add character to your handle.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Scimmy (w)
item.dc:creator: @T33J4Y T33J4Y
item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

[quote=“Assassins Creed Fan, post:4, topic:282012”]Erm, seriously.
First practice some more, then post your models on here.
The models you post, are like 15-60 minutes of work.
And, you’re an amateur modeller, so i’d like to give you the advice to spend like 2-3 hours on a model to get it nice shaped and stuff.
Then post, and ask if you can make something look nicer.

Just my opinion.[/quote]
Yeah I understand what your saying. I’m just doing this for fun I’m not trying to get serious about it yet and start spending 2-3 hours on each one. Yet. I’m still getting the hang of using Meta, and I was just wanting some of your opinions to see if I was heading in the right direction.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Scimmy (w)
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

[quote=“Assassins Creed Fan, post:6, topic:282012”]Uhm, clients can hold a poly count of 2,000…
And, i am suggesting it because he is still a beginner.
You’re more experienced at the moment.[/quote]

I kept trying and it didn’t work until 800 polys, until then it just went invisible. Might just be the Client i’m using.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Scimmy (w)
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

[quote=“T33J4Y, post:3, topic:282012”][quote author=0bbyme link=topic=372652.msg2811993#msg2811993 date=1244056821]
um try spending more time on your models.
[/quote]
I am. I’m going to spend at least 45 minutes on v2. This one I did in like 15 minutes[/quote]

No, spending time on your models is spending at least 1-2 hours on them. Pretty much all of my models took me about 2 hours and the only reason I stopped there was because if I made it more detailed it wouldn’t fit in any server. Like my dragunov I had to reduce that from 3000 Polys to 800 before it would fit. Dragunov took me about 3 and a half hours though.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Scimmy (w)
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

Erm, seriously.
First practice some more, then post your models on here.
The models you post, are like 15-60 minutes of work.
And, you’re an amateur modeller, so i’d like to give you the advice to spend like 2-3 hours on a model to get it nice shaped and stuff.
Then post, and ask if you can make something look nicer.

Just my opinion.

Read full topic
